conclusion: Objects A and B are shown above two separate cloth surfaces. Objects C, D, E, and F are placed on these cloth surfaces. The cloth surfaces are pinned at the corners.
Objects A and B are moving through the air and will eventually land on the cloth surfaces. The cloth surfaces are flexible and will deform under the weight of objects placed on them.
When objects A and B land on the cloth surfaces, their weight will cause the cloth to deform, creating a downward depression at the points where A and B make contact.
Objects C, D, E, and F will move toward the depression created by A and B due to the slope of the cloth caused by the deformation.
Objects C and D will move toward object A due to the depression caused by A on the left cloth surface.
Objects E and F will move toward object B due to the depression caused by B on the right cloth surface.
All objects will eventually settle at the lowest point of the respective depressions.

When objects A and B land on the cloth surfaces, their weight will deform the cloth, creating depressions. Objects C and D will move toward A, and objects E and F will move toward B, eventually settling at the lowest points of the depressions.
